result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nathan E Hart is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan E Hart

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerked by WH
Defendant Nathan E Hart in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Nathan E Hart in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 13CF312, 14CF371
PSI discussed;

385 days JAIL  credit.

13CF312  Count 1 Guilty and counts 2 & 3 were dismissed and read in.
14CF371 counts 1,2,3  were dismissed and read in.

Argument by State
Argument by Defense
Defendant relates
Court orders :

Prison  10 years  -  Imposed and Stayed
5 yrs Intiial with 5 years Extended supervision.

Probation  - 7 years
Jail -  365 days condtional jail.  Total credit  for time served, 385 days.  365 days against conditional time and  20  additional days of credit to be applied against the defendants sentence  in the event that his probation is revoked.
Must maintain absoulute sobriety
AODA and follow through with any recommended counseling or treatment.
Psyc Evaluation and follow through with any recommended counseling or treatment.
And any other  evaluations, counseling or treatment recommended by Probation Agent.
280 hours of community service with a minimum of 40 hours of community service  each year.
Court Costs - 
DNA sample plus  pay surcharge
C-31 filed   restitution of  $713.75  to be paid during probation.    Minimum of $50 per month payments on all financial obligations to begin within 90 days.

Written Explanation of Determinate Sentencing filed
Eligible for Substance abuse  and Challenge incarceration 
Voter rights - discussed.

The Dismissed and Read-In Disposition on counts 2 and 3 was erased. Counts 2 and 3 were then correctly dismissed as of 1/20/15. Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in Judgment of Conviction. rsw

records.addlTxt: 1/23/15 Plea hearing minutes amended per Judge Bitney's notes on original minute sheet in 13CF312.

Defendant Nathan E Hart in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Nathan E Hart in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
COVERS 13CF312 AND 14CF371.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented.  Court questions defendant.
13CF312: Defendant pleads Guilty on Count 1.  Court accepts and finds Guilty on Count 1.  Court orders Count 2 and Count 3 DRI.  
14CF371: Court orders count 1 DRI.
Court orders PSI.    
Defendant remanded to Jail.  Court orders Bond revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

BOND COVERS 13CF312 AND 14CF371.
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must not possess or consume controlled substances, except prescription drugs specifically prescribed to him, or drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Nathan E Hart in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Nathan E Hart in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
13CF312 and 14CF371 called.  Quash warrants.

13CF312 to track with 14CF371.
14CF371 Reading of Complaint waived.  Motion by Attorney Raymond to dismiss Counts 2 and 3.  State relates.  Court dismisses Counts 2 and 3 without prejudice.  Not guilty plea entered on Count 1.  Bond set.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond in court.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 14CF371 and 13CF312. 
State relates. Defense relates. State requests a Bench Warrant - Body Only - Wisconsin and Adjacent States. Court grants but Body Only - Statewide on both cases. Court grants.
